values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Patch Set 1:

I'm not so sure about this change.  The advantage of the master/slave vocabulary, inaccurate as it is, is that it's clear which one is the source and which one is the target.  The term 'replica' isn't quite exact, either, because the target isn't actually a replica until after all the stuff has been copied over (and maybe not even then, as new stuff may have been added to the source in the mean time).  I'd support changing master/slave to source/target, though.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Brian on the above.

Besides this is command line breaking change. So, I am not very comfortable with this change.

What's the pressing use case? like a really annoyed customer may be?

In the later case, a decent tradeoff is to create an alias for what the converged/agreed upon term is (hint hint: master/slave) and start deprecation path with appropriate warnings for the existing terms.

Haven't -2ed it to get some initial thoughts :-)

Patch Set 1:

General Note: Use of deprecated_name does create an alias so this does conform to that aspect of the suggested compromise already.  There is no command-line breaking change in the deprecation but there is a suggestion of such when the deprecation period completes.

If we need to compromise to provide an extended or indefinite deprecation period for this alias, that works too, but it waters down the value of the change each cycle the deprecated_name is retained.

While there is a historical convergence on the use of these terms in many software systems over time, it was never terribly accurate and probably reflects an insensitivity to the connotations associated with these terms which I would argue create an inhospitable ecosystem to some users and contributors impacted by or sensitive to human trafficking.

With several more-technically-accurate alternatives available which do not carry hostile connotations, it seems evident to me that in the spirit of the OpenStack CoC we should deprecate, or better eliminate, the use of this usage to foster a welcoming, considerate, and respectful community.

Patch Set 1:

Very nicely stated, Steve.  Plus, deprecated_name does most of the heavy lifting, so why not.

The current patch has master -> replica.  We'd purge all traces of Hegelianism if we went with the more neutral source -> target vocabulary.  That would require deprecating two options, not just one, which might be more complicated.  What do you think?

Patch Set 1:

I have no objections to source/target, just letting things simmer and more feedback to come in. I'll update that tomorrow and we can see where opinions stand.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I am not against calling it "replicatoken". However, the short parameter needs to be changed accordingly.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

We could deprecate this the *old fashioned* way. That means adding options directly and having the old ones include *some* of the deprecation information, adding new ones with new short options. And probably providing a longer deprecation cycle.

Patch Set 1:

One problem with using Source / Target and changing the short options is that 't' and 'S' are already taken so it isn't clear what the short options should be. My current idea is to use the second letter in the word:
 * s'o'urce 
 * t'a'rget

This short is unique to the word such that there is no 'o' in target and no 'a' in source; there is less ambiguity.

This concern has blocked this review from proceeding. I need input on how to proceed.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Patch Set 1:

> One problem with using Source / Target and changing the short options is that 't' and 'S' are already taken

Yes, and -S is exactly the opposite of what we want, which is a Big Problem because after attending the API-WG sessions yesterday, I was going to suggest not deprecating these at all, just adding the new option names and silently accepting the old ones.  (That way, old operator scripts will still work, and those people were either already insulted by the old vocabulary and it's too late, or they didn't notice.)  But I don't think we want to silently accept an -S option when we're talking source/target, but -S sets the token for the target, not the source.

I don't have anything helpful to add ATM, will have to look up some synonyms and see what looks good.

Patch Set 1:

How about:

 origin, use -o
 goal, use -g

"Origin" is very clear about which glance is the source of the replication, and "goal" isn't bad, it's what you're trying to accomplish, and at least it's clearly not your starting point, so should not be confusing.

It's too bad that we can't use "source" and "target", because they are really widely used, but this will allow us to make Steve's change, keep the "legacy" options, and (probably) not have mistakes by new users (if you're thinking "origin" or "goal", -M or -S are not going to come to mind at all as possible short option names).

@Steve: (a) what do you think of "origin" and "goal", and (b) what do you think of silent acceptance instead of deprecation?

Patch Set 1:

Thinking more about the options, I am not enthusiastic about 'o' for a short param but it is better than a capital, due to potential visual confusion.

Using 'Home' can help disambiguate the obvious short param for either Origin or Source. That leaves us with Home/Target or Home/Goal. I think both of those could work.

The other option is to use the Source/Target terminology and not provide short params. I'm leaning toward this latter option at the moment but still looking for feedback.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 7:

realizing now that the way DeprecatedOpt works is a problem because it gives an inferior deprecation notice and doesn't support the short options at all

Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Some thoughts and suggestions.

The way DeprecatedOpt works is that, any new opt, if mapped to an old opt will override the old opt.

If we are sticking to using "sourcetoken" and "targettoken" and mapping them to "mastertoken" and "slavetoken" respectively, the problem is with the conflicting short "S" for both "sourcetoken" and "slavetoken". (See [1])

So I suggest that we edit the name of the proposed "sourcetoken" to something else like "origintoken". The proposal of "targettoken" is cool. 
Then, we can have shorts mapped using the DeprecateOpt option we have. I have pasted only the lines edited in [2]. 

Thoughts? Let me know what you think.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/602009/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/602011/

Patch Set 8:

I was trying to avoid labels starting with o and i and L, as these letters can be easily confused with numbers, or with each other, in some fonts and typesets
